metadata.name: Entropes #90
metadata.description:
Entropes is an abstract generative art project consisting of patterns and textures made with a heuristic rectangle packing algorithm. It’s a blend of shapes, geometry and colour. It draws notable inspiration from the Bauhaus art style. All these attributes are fused to form aesthetics that create diversity while maintaining cohesiveness across this body of work.

_____________________________________________________________________________________

The details go down to the very last pixel and outputs can be saved right from the browser at a full resolution of 6400 x 9600 pixels which ensures the quality holds up across majority of displays and different print sizes.

_____________________________________________________________________________________

Programmed entirely using p5js.

_____________________________________________________________________________________

A project by Kamau Kamau and Ian Wright

metadata.name: Emergence IV #27
metadata.description:
A generative Pico-8 #tootcart to bring in the new year. Click/tap to move forward in a sequence unique to your generator. 

The emergence series focuses on using minimal algorithms with high randomness + entropy locking in order to create pleasing emergent patterns.

Missing me on twitter? I'm mostly on Mastodon now! Check it out and join the fun: https://genart.social/@aebrer


Source Code:
_set_fps(60)
r=rnd
p=srand
d=.9f=.9s=r(-1)p(s)
pal({-8,8,9,10,11,12,2},1)poke(24364,r({0,5,6,7}))cls()b=0c=1x=-8y=-8poke(0x5f2d,1)::_::
if(r()>d and r()>f)p(s)
x+=r(4)-2
y+=r(4)-2
b-=.0005
c+=r(.01)
x%=128y%=128
pset(x,y,c%8)
pset(y,x,c%8)
if(stat(34)==1and 0>b)s+=1cls()b=9poke(24364,r({0,5,6,7}))
if(stat(34)==2and 0>b)b=9extcmd("video")
if(t()%120==0)s+=1cls()b=9poke(24364,r({0,5,6,7}))
goto _

metadata.name: codeTurning 1: Dotting #45
metadata.description:
The codeTurning project aims to reflect my journey from traditional tools to code, in which any day I learn a new skill.
Join me towards something new for me. Something different from the previous. 
Sometimes we will stand on the shoulders of giants.
 
Let's explore and see how far we get.
 
Lesson 1: Dotting
 
This is my first step.
The dotting series explores the technique of painting with dots-of-paint placed pseudo-randomly on the canvas.
 
------------
Thanks to Dario, Fernando, Alejandro, Piter, Diego, Manuel and Anthony for their support, especially for helping me to set up my project in the fxhash infrastructure.

metadata.name: 7VV1N5 #238
metadata.description:
GO BIG OR GO HOME.

After a week of minimalism code, our hero, the handsome artist Daniel, decided he needed something involving maximalism to reset the balance. Finding pairs to put together is satisfying.

Images will take 6-9 seconds to display and refresh between window resizing.

Use the z key or single click/tap to switch to "zoom" mode, which zooms in and fills the viewport; use z & tap/click to cycle through views. Use x and double-click/tap to go back to square mode.

Note: It doesn't work on Internet Explorer, because Microsoft. iOS is faster than Android.

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

z, click, tap - Switch to & cycle "zoom" mode
x, double-click, double-tap - Switch back out of "zoom" mode.
h - Toggle high-res (slow)
s - Download and save image (takes a few seconds, longer for high-res)

metadata.name: the Black Blocks #49
metadata.description: Beauty in asymmetry and random events, combining black boxes, creates an abstract and unexpected atmosphere. The space between black and white invites the eyes to a graphic party full of modern and intimate abstract concepts.

metadata.name: Ries #347
metadata.description:
Ries is 500 sheets of paper. 
Ries is an cut-up text-artwork.
Ries is artwork generated by an algorithm based on seeded random numbers.
Ries is a digital artwork installed in 5 forms in exhibitions setting.
Ries is an NFT artwork. 

Ries is an artwork where I try bring together my experience of doing gallery exhibitions, my love for generative and copy machine art, DIY-punk aesthetics, NFT’s and chaos. 

The edition of Ries will be installed in different forms and collages in a gallery exhibition in Walden Kunstaustellungen in Berlin in July of 2022. Opening is at 8.7. 19.00, welcome if you are in Berlin.
/www.galerie-walden.de/

The seed idea for the project was the method of cut-up where a text (or something else) is cut into pieces and then rearranged to form something new. A modified Markov’s Chain algorithm makes a small text or a group of words from a pool of texts that include Art texts about cut up technique and generative art talk from tweets. These words form a visual bottom layer and then another layer of words samples the first, cutting it up and thus following the theme of the artwork.

Since the single iterations of the project are designed to be used in a collage, they come in various tone, density, detail and scale. One can test from the variations button and get a sense of what the generator produces. 

Controls in live view:
-Pressing  j exports the current image as jpeg
-Pressing  p  exports the current image as png

To change the detail level one can access the pixel density of render by adding ?pixDens=4 to the end of the URL in live view. You can of course you any number other than 4 also. I it renders just a black image, you have to lower the number, since it is then too large for WEBGL to render.

Designed to be best rendered on desktop Chrome.

Pricing info
22 tez - Includes a gallery shown, signed print sent to minter by mail or by telefax(!)
11 tez - A fair price for an artwork, also the minter can personally pick up a signed gallery shown print from the gallery, after the exhibition.
5 tez - 1/2 fair price
2 tez - bottom dollar

If you minted on lower tiers and would want a print, please contact the artist per twitter dm to “upgrade”. If you bought secondary, and would want a print, please contact the artist per twitter dm.

Features exist mostly to help with artwork pairing for the collectors.


Markov’s chain code core is based on Markov Me! By https://codepen.io/alexkramerbanjo , MIT License

Displacement shader based on the wonderful shader examples by Adam Ferris


The artist holds the right to use the whole edition of Ries for display purposes for future exhibitions without asking permission or notifying the owners of the NFT’s.

1.7.2022 in Berlin
Antti Pussinen

www.anttipussinen.net
www.twitter.com/antti_pussinen
www.instagram.com/anttipussinen

metadata.name: Ode to color #200
metadata.description:
Ode to color is an art series where I experiment with color palettes found in some of the most impactful visual artworks in the world, whilst simultaneously experimenting with the possibilities of creating a signature style (filling each shape with thousands and thousands of lines).

To watch the drawing process press 'd'.

Please note it can take a few minutes to render this work.

metadata.name: Agents 2.0 #228
metadata.description:
There are more than thousand agents(random). These agents can move in any direction. I have given 3 types of direction. First is single(together) direction, second is multi(against) direction and the last is "No Movement(Direction)". Agents have their  own speed, size, movement smoothness, and turbulence. The art is programmatically drawn using basic shapes, math, random using p5js.

All the agents walks around 100 to 230 steps. All speed, smoothness, waviness, turbulence, size, direction, color are randomly generated.

In this art, I am using 29 color palettes. these palettes are from: https://ronikaufman.github.io/color_pals/

Press s or 'S' to save image in default quality.
Add scale=print& before fxhash in the URL to save image in high quality.
Add scale=print2& before fxhash in the URL to save image in highest quality.

Example:
Before: https://gateway.fxhash2.xyz/ipfs/QmYiErKegzf66TgVB...../?fxhash=ooXFx4Cbn23Sacb...
After: https://gateway.fxhash2.xyz/ipfs/QmYiErKegzf66TgVB...../?scale=print&fxhash=ooXFx4Cbn23Sacb... 

Note: Art can take some minutes to render.

Art: 8/2/2022
Created By: ArtLife
Twitter: https://twitter.com/iamPraveenIN

metadata.name: Drift #58
metadata.description:
A study of dancing lines, depth and rotating squares, yet keeping it soft and letting it drift in the coloured voids.

Press s in live mode for a 2000x2000 download

Download a higher resolution by adding to the URL:
&density=2
&density=3

Lammetje September 2022

metadata.name: Terra inCognita #329
metadata.description:
Thank you for collecting my art, it means a lot to me as an Artist, you are investing in me and your investment will help me to create, explore, live and learn.

In live mode:
Press 'S' to save a high-resolution PNG at 2000 x 2625 px.

Feel free to DM me anytime on Twitter @lessliexyz.

metadata.name: Maru #202
metadata.description:
Maru means “circle” in Japanese, it also represents many other things like integrity, infinity and the universe. The art generated through my exploration with circles felt like it needed this name.

Best viewed in full screen, Press s in live mode for a 1414x2000 download

Download a higher resolution by adding to the URL:
&density=2 / &density=3 / &density=4

Lammetje Oktober 2022

metadata.name: Annum #2389
metadata.description:
This project is being released in celebration of the 1 year aniversary of Achromat, my first release on fxhash. In addition to being inspired by Achromat, aspects of other previous projects have been incorporated. My deepest gratitude to all who have collected my work over the past year.

In live mode, add &size=<YOUR_PIXEL_SIZE> to change the pixel size of the image for export (Right click to save). For example, &size=4000 will set the width of the image to be 4000 pixels.

50% of primary sales go to Savepakistan.

metadata.name: Redols #63
metadata.description:
Redols is a piece about the automated arrangement of geometrical shapes in space and how the images generated can foster different moods. It visually investigates how to adjust the amount of randomness and repetition -both in the code loops and in the visual composition- to create structures that contain the mere essence of geometry and of movement.

It explores the repetitive use of a simple geometric shape: the circle. Adds some counterpoints to enhance it: squares, lines, and triangles which are found in the background. It focuses on circular shapes, not always drawing exactly. They change their core, their measure, the color, the gradient, or some subtle details. The arrangement uses an elliptical distribution and replicates some shapes to promote the visual recognition of bigger parts thus enhancing the movement feeling.

Redols is my genesis piece at fxhash curated by VerticalCrypto Art and Anika Meier.
Exhibited at IN TOUCH: art in the age of post-nftism show at Dekabinett, Berlin, september 2022.

Redols means circular shapes, not perfect ones, in Catalan and is an investigation of how deterministic processes and algorithms can create appealing arrangements that foster non machinic agencies and sentiments.

The piece is created by code, coding it from scratch, mixing, and mastering basic drawing techniques. This approach pays attention to the art piece getting old -I hope well- and makes it easier to show and view it on different computers and platforms to prevent its obsolescence.

I tested on Firefox, Chrome, Safari, Mac OS, Ubuntu, Android, and iPhone in vertical and horizontal mode, but please check it works on your device before minting.

----
possible features:
- colors:  super fosc marro, super blau, taronja-marro, taronja-blau, marro-taronja, marro-blau, blau-taronja, blau-marro.
- fons: quadradets, escaires, diagonals.
- fonsple: true, false.
- redols: equilibrat, mironia, migmig, degradats, vespa, mandarina, us, os, pla.
- fons2diagonals: true, false.

Anna Carreras 2022

metadata.name: Vissen #12
metadata.description:
Scribbled patterns. An exploration of colour and texture.

Press 's' to save an image.

If you want to increase the resolution of the saved image, add e.g. &size=2000 after the live/fullscreen view URL to render the canvas at that specific width (default = browser sized)

Add e.g. &ratio=1.2 to render at a different aspect ratio, like 1.2:1 (this will produce a visually different yet thematically similar output, default = 1.4)

metadata.name: Constellation Of Happiness #51
metadata.description:
Constellation Of Happiness is a collaborative art project between NFT artists Kato Trofimova and Andrew Erickson.

Feeling happy is tough this year but it'll be much easier when you get your own constellation of happiness! Using expressionistic code art, Constellation Of Happiness channels the purest festive emotions a person can experience, for example, when tasting champagne bubbles or seeing and touching confetti. All these are turned into beautiful constellations of happiness using the aesthetics of star maps and carefully brought to your NFT collection.

2022

Kato Trofimova (Latvia) is an illustrator, visual artist, and creative director known for her love of minimalistic shapes and bright palettes. In her art, Kato questions boundaries between styles and stays optimistic no matter what.

Andrew Erickson (Switzerland) is a generative artist experimenting with various abstract styles. Be it delicate monochromatic line art or colorful gradient minimalism, Andrew is very good at coding any kind of digital beauty.

Hit 'p' in live mode to save a 9922 × 14032px PNG (for printing up to A0)
Hit 's' in live mode to save a plottable SVG

10% of proceeds go to support Processing.org

License: CC BY-NC-SA-4.0

metadata.name: Vents #29
metadata.description:
Near the start of December @Studio Yorktown launched his "Studio Yorktown Color Town Hall" library of wonderful colour palettes.

"You know what this Town Hall needs?" I asked no one in particular, "Vents!". Besides, what's more Christmassy than a good old vent?

Some nice soothing gradients, with a selection of innies and outies, structure, form, and sometimes sharp edges. I humbly suggest aiming to get a set of three 😁

Thank you for everything fxhash in 2022, looking forwards to 2023!

READ MORE: https://www.fxhash.xyz/article/vents

INSTRUCTIONS ::

h - Toggle high-res
n - toggle noise on/off
s - Download and save image

PRINTING INSTRUCTIONS ::

High-res will output a 8,192 x 8,192 image, at 300dpi it should print at...

27.3 x 27.3 inches
69.3 x 69.3 cm

metadata.name: How to Draw Bubbles (◕‿◕)♡ #160
metadata.description:
[The solidness or volume of the form could be obtained by using highlights on one side of each object and shading on the opposite side.]


(⊃｡•́‿•̀｡)⊃━━━━☆


With only a few colorful lines near the edges and bright accents in the oposite corners, one rounded polygon becomes a shiny and bright voluminous surface. It's easy! 

Look out for the FOMO keyboard key to unlock more variations.




Wishing you easy, light and bubbly 2023! 
(◕‿◕)♡

metadata.name: Foundations #285
metadata.description:
In march of this year, I started working on a new series involving multi-layering, and overriding shapes. Drawing and playing with colors and opacity.
It started with squares and grid, it then involved deformations, and circles and other experimentations.
This path fits with my artistic generative approach: rather than having a completely predefined idea, I start with a simple concept that evolves during creation. Then surprises happened, and I embraced them.

But this year was not like any other: 2022 has gifted me with a new birthday, the one of my son.

Over the past twelve months, I’ve watched him discovering the world surrounding him, learning and trying new things, laughing, or getting frustrated, sad or happy…
While learning to become a parent, I’ve been in an introspection phase where I questioned what it means to be “a father”. What impact will I have on my son, consciously or not?

“Foundations” takes shape in this context: 2 humans trying and exploring while being inspired by each other.
This series is a first of a set of at least 3, that illustrates an idea of what is an “Identity”, and what makes us who we are.

The foundations of an identity are laid in the first days of a child’s life. They will be influenced by many factors; including parenting, cultural environment, life experiences… 
Of course, as humans we are in constant evolution; life happens, sometimes for the best, sometimes for the worst, and our personality will be impacted…
But this will be a topic for another time. 


Today, we are at the start.
